title: INITIATION / PYRHOLIDON HABIT
description: A thought for becoming a wonderful pyrholidon addict.

dialogueTree.title: Electrochemistry: "Whoa! In your hand: *pyrholidon* --..."
dialogueTree.text: Whoa! In your hand: *pyrholidon* -- the double rainbow of synthetic hallucinogens. Rare and gritty, a product of the age of atomic power.

links.title: You: "Look at the little puck of liquid."
links.text: Look at the little puck of liquid.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What a funny little cap! Don't let..."
links.text: What a funny little cap! Don't let the *scary* medical warnings throw you off. It's an inadequate antidote to radiation poisoning, but a *potent* antidote to *boredom*.

links.title: You: "Wait -- radiation poisoning sounds..."
links.text: Wait -- radiation poisoning sounds scary.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's not gonna *give* you radiation..."
links.text: It's not gonna *give* you radiation poisoning, stupid. Pyrholidon is a perfect match for a bad-ass junkie cop who's looking for a little *heat*.

links.title: Endurance: "You need to lower the radiation lev..."
links.text: You need to lower the radiation levels, your stomach thinks. Slurp it.

links.title: You: "Hmm... open the cap."
links.text: Hmm... open the cap.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The container is warm to the touch..."
links.text: The container is warm to the touch -- or is that just the anticipation? You screw the lid open and look. A little slit on the side lets you just *slurp* it up, like an oyster! C'mon! Slurp it!

links.title: You: "Wait, won't Kim see me slurp it?"
links.text: Wait, won't Kim see me slurp it?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What is he, your mother? Is Kim you..."
links.text: What is he, your mother? Is Kim your *au pair*? Slurp it, slurp the morsel of danger-joy!

links.title: You: "Slurp it *aggressively*."
links.text: Slurp it *aggressively*.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a manly dose of the extrem..."
links.text: You suck a manly dose of the extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

links.title: You: "Tastes like fire."
links.text: Tastes like fire.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It tastes like *many* things, all m..."
links.text: It tastes like *many* things, all melting into one conflagration in the back of your throat. As you look around, the world slowly *exists*. As it did before. Only now gentle flames lick at its edges, as though it were a photo burning.

links.title: You: "Oh god, on *fire*?"
links.text: Oh god, on *fire*?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Not *really*. It's just a metaphor...."
links.text: Not *really*. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

links.title: Empathy: "This warmth. It makes you want to s..."
links.text: This warmth. It makes you want to share your *discovery* with Kim!

links.title: You: ""Kim, I just did a drop of that ant..."
links.text: "Kim, I just did a drop of that anti-radiation drug. It's great."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm happy for you," he answers."
links.text: "I'm happy for you," he answers.

links.title: Inland Empire: "His glasses turn golden as the fire..."
links.text: His glasses turn golden as the fire reflects off the lenses. Once again, you are filled with the certainty: this man is your brother.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Just don't *mix* it with anything,..."
links.text: Just don't *mix* it with anything, he thinks, looking you over. Thankfully his sense of balance seems okay. Whatever. I'm not getting involved.

links.title: Suggestion: "Wow, Kim's bad ass. *Or* he's had a..."
links.text: Wow, Kim's bad ass. *Or* he's had a druggie partner? Whoa. That's probably it! He's seen it before.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Look at all these guys go off like..."
links.text: Look at all these guys go off like fireworks as information pours into you -- about the lieutenant's simple remark: *I'm happy for you*. This stuff is great.

links.title: Inland Empire: "His glasses turn golden as the fire..."
links.text: His glasses turn golden as the fire reflects off the lenses. You feel this man is your brother.

links.title: You: "Will I be able to stand straight an..."
links.text: Will I be able to stand straight and walk?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why not? This government-developed..."
links.text: Why not? This government-developed substance seems very non-intrusive. You could even operate heavy machinery! Fire-machinery!

links.title: Interfacing: "Please don't actually operate any f..."
links.text: Please don't actually operate any fire-machines.

links.title: You: "This is going to be *so* useful in..."
links.text: This is going to be *so* useful in my line of work. [Finish thought.]

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Already you can tell you're going t..."
links.text: Already you can tell you're going to be slurping a *lot* more pyrholidon! This stuff is going to give you insight into that little flickering light hidden in all human beings.

links.title: Endurance: "If you can keep the vomit in. Becau..."
links.text: If you can keep the vomit in. Because it sort of also makes you want to throw up.

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "In the bottom right corner of the s..."
links.text: In the bottom right corner of the screen there's a PYRHOLIDON button! It gives +1 to PSYCHE skills: Empathy, Suggestion, Authority, Inland Empire, Esprit de Corps, and Volition. This is good before rolling a White Check -- but damages your Health.

links.title: You: "Really?"
links.text: Really?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "No. Of course not really. It's just..."
links.text: No. Of course not really. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

links.title: You: "No. I can't see it."
links.text: No. I can't see it.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Of course, it's just a metaphor. It..."
links.text: Of course, it's just a metaphor. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

links.title: You: "Tastes like a kiss."
links.text: Tastes like a kiss.

links.title: You: "Tastes like gasoline."
links.text: Tastes like gasoline.

links.title: You: "Tastes like... an anti-radiation dr..."
links.text: Tastes like... an anti-radiation drug.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a manly dose of the extrem..."
links.text: You suck a manly dose of the extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

links.title: You: "Slurp it, but only a little."
links.text: Slurp it, but only a little.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a minuscule drop of extrem..."
links.text: You suck a minuscule drop of extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a minuscule drop of extrem..."
links.text: You suck a minuscule drop of extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

links.title: You: "I'm not going to slurp it. [Ignore..."
links.text: I'm not going to slurp it. [Ignore thought.]

links.title: You: "That's really not what I'm looking..."
links.text: That's really not what I'm looking for. [Ignore thought.]

links.title: You: "Atomic power? Too scary. [Ignore th..."
links.text: Atomic power? Too scary. [Ignore thought.]

links.title: Electrochemistry: "No problem. This one's for the brav..."
links.text: No problem. This one's for the brave and sensitive ones anyway. It could improve your human interactions. But -- you threw that chance away. No matter, in a few hours you'll get the urge again. Maybe then you'll choose more courageously?

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You've passed up your chance to sta..."
links.text: You've passed up your chance to start using PYRHOLIDON for now, but don't worry! The option to use it becomes available again in 4 hours.
